text:
hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with ram rings sorry lamb wings

sorry
ram wings that's right this recipe might

be hard to say three times fast but it's
easy to make and even easier to eat

thanks to a delicious glaze made from
rosemary ancho and molasses so yes the

name is an acronym but despite this
being completely contrived to fit my

Super Bowl snack narrative they really
did come out amazingly well so with that

let's go ahead and get started
and for this we're gonna need a couple

pounds of chicken wing sections which I
bought like this already done for me

because they were on sale but if
possible you really do want to buy the

whole wings and cut your own although
I'm not going to tell you exactly why

until later in the video but anyway to
our drums and flats we will add a little

bit of vegetable oil as well as a
generous amount of kosher salt followed

by some freshly and finely minced
rosemary as well as a whole bunch of

beautiful brick-red ground ancho chili
and you see how that looks all nice and

fresh that's because it's nice and fresh
all right do not use like a

seven-year-old chili powder for this ok
the fresher the better and then speaking

of better we'll also toss in a little
bit of cayenne as well as a couple

tablespoons of white distilled vinegar
which is what we add when we want

acidity but not flavor and then we'll go
ahead and finish up our marinade with

similar asses and then once that Sam
we'll go ahead and take a spatula and

mix this all together and as far as the
molasses goes I would say add one spoon

if you like it two spoons if you love it
but no spoons if you don't ok molasses

has a very distinct earthy sort of
bittersweet flavor that not everybody

likes and if you are one of these people
you could substitute with maple syrup

which would allow you to still call
these Ram wings or honey which in that

case you'd have to call them raw wings
as in rah-rah-sis-boom-bah which by the

way was a very popular cheer we used to
do back in the early 1900s but anyway

that's gonna be up to you I mean you are
for all the Fat Boy slim of this

delicious acronym but regardless of
which sticky sweet substance you go with

once we have everything thoroughly
combined what we're going to want to do

is wrap this and then we'll pop
in the fridge to marinate anywhere

between 4 and 12 hours after which we
can go ahead and transfer those onto a

lined baking sheet and we will spread
those out into a single layer spaced as

evenly as possible oh and remember
earlier when I said it was better to buy

whole wings and cut them yourself
the reason is you're gonna get pieces

much more uniform in size ok as we
spread these out you're gonna see small

flats next to big flats and big Dramat
snacks too small jar mats so if you can

split them yourself and by the way once
those are spread out if you have a

little bit of sauce left at the bottom
of the bowl

feel free to transfer that on a little
bit here and a little bit there and

that's it once our wings are panned up
they are ready to transfer into the

center of a 400 degree oven for about 45
minutes or so or until those wings are

completely cooked through and what we're
gonna do while those are roasting is

make what we call in the business the
finishing glaze which we will start with

a little bit of molasses as well as a
little touch of honey for some non

molasses sweetness we will also add in a
little more ancho as well as a big pinch

of salt a little shake of cayenne and
then last but not least the freshly

squeezed juice of one lime and if you're
wondering why we didn't just add all

that stuff to the marinade which is a
good question but if we had it just

would not taste the same is tossing the
cook wings in this at the end ok these

ingredients especially the lime in the
honey will have a totally different

flavor cooked then they will if we toss
them with our chicken wings at the end

uncooked and if you don't believe me try
it it really does make a big difference

but anyway we'll go ahead and mix up our
finishing glaze and we'll set that aside

until our wings are cooked which after
about 45 minutes mine were and they

looked a little something like this
which i think is just absolutely

beautiful but hang on it gets even
better because what we're gonna do is

soon as these come out of the oven
while they're still piping hot it's

carefully transfer those into our
finishing glaze and what we'll do is

give those a good toss with a spatula or
a large spoon or if you're from western

New York like me and you're very
experienced saucing buffalo chicken

wings you can just grab the bowl and
toss them like this and what we're going

to want to do is give these a toss let
them sit for five minutes and then give

them one more toss before serving and by
time we finished with that second

tossing most if not all that glaze
should be attached to the wings and we

should not see a lot at the bottom of
the bowl and that's it once that's been

accomplished we can transfer those onto
our serving platter and possibly garnish

with some fresh lime as well as an
optional but highly recommended dusting

of ancho on the top okay I think that's
gonna give it a beautiful professionally

finished appearance plus it looks cool
on the limes and that's it our Ram wings

are done and I was really hoping these
would taste good since as I admitted to

earlier I did not choose these
ingredients because I thought they would

go good together
I chose them because they spelled Ram

which is one of the teams in the game
the one not everybody hates but anyway

the point I'm making is that these
ingredients work very well together and

we're a triumph of earthy sweet savory
heat and above and beyond what they

taste like make sure you cook your wings
long enough alright that meat should be

coming off the bones very cleanly and if
it doesn't they needed more time so do

not rush these okay they're chicken
wings not quarterbacks and what I love

so much about this style of chicken wing
which I generically refer to as a sticky

wing is that we don't have to worry
about any deep frying or oven frying or

having to flip them over halfway through
or worrying about them getting crispy

all right because these are marinated
and cooked wet we don't need to care

that much about the surface especially
because we toss those in that finishing

glaze before we eat so I really do love
this method and for me if you are gonna

cook for a big party doing these are a
very easy call I mean not quite as easy

a call as that passed interference was
not very easy nonetheless and I think if

you put a platter of these out of your
party everybody's gonna be happy no

matter who they're rooting for except
for the Saints fans they're not gonna be

happy for a long time but you know what
even they will be cheered up a little

bit by these that's how good they are
which is why I really do hope you give

these a try soon so head over to food
wishes calm for all the ingredient

amounts of more info as usual and as
always
enjoy
you
